subject: Re: Your website is ready to review!
preview: Hi Casey, We have been looking into this and noticed that this page has been setup: https://tarabliss.com.au/members/account/Do you know if this works/is there a way you can check?

full_threads.body:
Hi Casey, 

We have been looking into this and noticed that this page has been setup: https://tarabliss.com.au/members/account/

Do you know if this works/is there a way you can check?

Awesome, thanks for that!

I heard back from ActiveMember360. The documentation provided was right for [mbr_password_change] though they said to note that it will only show for bonafide logged in users who also exist in ActiveCampaign, not show for admin.

Casey
BLISS SUPPORT

e. support@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au

Courage | Creation | Collaborative Leadership

doTERRA Presidential Diamond | Author | 'Rebels of Light'

Hi Casey, 

Ok sure, that's a backup we were running some tests on that I forgot about, all good, I have now removed it.

Hi again Heath,

I just jumped into Active Campaign to check the web hooks again and the site you guys set up has shown up again. This hook needs to be taken off on Wordpress too I believe if you can :)

Casey

doTERRA Presidential Diamond | Author | 'Rebels of Light'

Hi Casey, 

Just confirming we have sorted out the footer now.
@heath I think its just cache. its all fine on my end. I just cleared it. Let me know if this its working?

@joel thanks for that, but now the profile page here: https://tarabliss.com.au/members/profile/ has the issue again. Can we stick the footer to the bottom of the browser some other way? Screen shot attached.

Thanks for that! Such fun doing the change over :)

I've emailed through to ActiveMember360 to see about how to get the password change option back but I also found this on their website: https://activemember360.com/docs/mbr_password_change/ given that our other shortcode seemed to go pear shaped perhaps it's a simple fix. I'm asking to see if there's better information though.

Casey

doTERRA Presidential Diamond | Author | 'Rebels of Light'
@heath All good now on the footer.

Hi Casey, 

That's great news, yes please check in with active campaign regarding the password reset. We are looking into the footer now. I'll send you an update.
@joel can you please look at the footer issue... I think this might be because of the the change we made last week on the account page... do you remember?

Hi Heath,

Thanks for this. I've just jumped into AC and deleted the web hooks there, I ran a test contact and it looks to have generated the password no worries which is great. Though the change password option isn't showing in the profile at all. Would it be easier for you to communicate with AM360 about this?

Another thing I noticed when I scrolled down to jump into the opt-in was that the footer seems to now take up a whole screen which is new since we changed over the site last week.



Casey

doTERRA Presidential Diamond | Author | 'Rebels of Light'

Hi Casey, 

The staging site is on the old server, I managed to get in there and deactivate the Active Campaign plugin. 

So, can you now please delete any webhooks in your Active Campaign account that are not the live domain i.e. https://tarabliss.com.au and we will see if that works?

Good morning,

If you don't need it then that would be fine as I wouldn't even know how to access it!

What do you need from us to action this?

Thank you,

Casey

doTERRA Presidential Diamond | Author | 'Rebels of Light'

Hi Casey, 

I have had a look into this. The staging.tarabliss.com.au should really just be removed as it's no longer required. It sounds like that might do the trick? 

What do you think?

Good morning Heath,

I'll check those out today but at a quick glance all seems well!

I've heard back from AM360 re: the passwords, it might be something we need you to look into. I've copied their response below - the staging site was hosted on Amazon I believe, if I give you those details can you fix that up?

__

As we explained previously when you have ActiveMember360 installed on several sites only one site will ever be used to generate the password.

That site should always be available to perform that function.

This applies to all sites using ActiveMember360 with webhooks enabled.

We see that the site https://staging.tarabliss.com.au is currently the one used for generating the password.

That site must be able to receive HTTP POSTs from ActiveCampaign to trigger the password generation.

Looking at the API logs we see no HTTP POSTs being received. This means that site is blocking those HTTP POSTs

So it appears that the security settings on your host/firewall or security plugins are blocking HTTP POSTs to your WordPress site of the form:

This prevents the generation of the password.

You should either configure your security pluginsor ask your hosting to permit HTTP POSTs from the following wildcard:

https://staging.tarabliss.com.au/?mbr*

Also ensure that they allow blank user agents, and white list the following ActiveCampaign IPs:

173.193.9.0/24
173.193.9.198
23.20.225.34
34.192.144.26
34.199.37.208
34.230.175.182
34.233.145.248
52.7.228.32
52.45.6.233
52.45.183.46
52.55.227.5
52.72.254.82
52.86.138.218

This is not a definitive list of the IPs used by ActiveCampaign. Your server logs should indicate if there are others that are being blocked.

When using WordFence the definition is:
173.193.9.[0-255]

instead of:
173.193.9.0/24

__

Casey
BLISS SUPPORT

e. support@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au

Courage | Creation | Collaborative Leadership

doTERRA Presidential Diamond | Author | 'Rebels of Light'

Oh that's awesome and makes sense. I'll have to remember that one. 

Confirming have now:

  • Fixed up the form styling
  • Fixed the read more accordion issue on the Podcasts 
  • Fixed the footer on the Profile page (note, we have filled the footer 'down', instead of moving it all the way down as this is more future proof and will perform better on all devices). 

Let me know if there is anything else and also how you go with the password issue.

Ah! I solved my browser issue. An adblocker had a new setting enabled to block "Fanboy Annoyances" as they call them, such as social widgets.

Casey
